Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: Jaisanchez
Reviews.Content: I have spent a week in this hotel and I would like to recommend it very earnestly. It's splendidly situated, just in front of the Istambul tramway; is very comfortable, very well climatized, the buffet breakfast is fresh and varied, and the staff friendly and helpful. Not to mention the shower and the bathroom, gorgeous. I was also helped to find a cab from and to the Airport, at very modic prices. So, if you like second rate hotels and shabby places, abstain from Kent Hotel and stay anywhere else! Jaime Sanchez Ratia (Spain)

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and reasonably-priced hotel on the edge of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rahulpat
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay recently at the Kent Hotel Istanbul. The room I had was clean, modern and tasteful, although even for winter it got very stuffy. Excellent granite bathroom (even the shower, which had a delightful rainforest head). The area is quiet and the Laleli-Uiversite tram stop was right around the corner (5-10 mins to historic center sites and maybe 20 to get to trendier Taksim). Room service was super prompt and shockingly, not that expensive - decent breakfast spread too..and free Wi-Fi with a strong signal! Customer service was otherwise hit-or-miss, but language wasn't too much of an issue with the staff. The location is both a positive and negative. While you can walk to the Grand Bazaar in a few minutes, the only restaurants, bars and cafe's around there are mediocre, over-priced touristy spots. Would have personally preferred to be around the more lively and local Taksim/Istiklal for its amenities, but otherwise I had a really good experience at the Kent.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul and Hagia Sofia”
Reviews.Author: Normy13
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and comfortable; buffet breakfast was the best of our entire trip through Turkey. Noise factor was a problem around 6 am - next to a mosque! Otherwise, great location; tram stop right in front of hotel. Staff very friendly but short on English understanding.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, contemporary, fast and reliable internet, excellent location, great breakfast, nice staff, big room”
Reviews.Author: bzz77
Reviews.Content: I have heard that the hotel scene in Istanbul can be rather iffy. A friend who works as an Istanbul tour guide recommended this hotel to me and I have had a great stay (two nights, total). The location couldn't be better--it is right by a tram stop (more reliable, less risky than local taxis, according to my tour guide friend). It is about a five-minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. It is also close (about three tram stops) to the Blue (Sultan Ahmed) Mosque, Roman hippodrome, and surrounding attractions. My room is clean, large, very nicely designed, and there is no stale cigarette smell (a plus in Turkey, I think). The internet connection is fast and reliable. There's a hair-dryer and it works. There are large mirrors. Even though my room faces on to a busy street, it is quiet. Breakfast was EXCELLENT. There's a huge selection of food--all kinds of cheese, eggs, meat, salad, fruit. The dining area is large, roomy, and modern. There's a beautifully designed bar area with lots of seating. Staff members can mostly speak English or can quickly access someone who can and they're friendly and polite. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great mid size hotel”
Reviews.Author: royaashcroft
Reviews.Content: came by this hotel va group booking through a tour company, its a decent 4 star place, contemporary furnishings, friendly staff and well located for grand bazaar and the main sights, food is good and the restauarant is smartly decorated, helpful staff! what more do you need! plus the fatc it rates itself 4 satr and lives up to it. Only 20 mins from Attaturk airport a 30 TL ride

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PastyPieMan
Reviews.Content: Almost everything about this hotel was perfect. Location almost opposite the grand Bazaar, and a short interesting walk (maybe a mile, or a mile and a half) to the Blue Mosque, and Topkapi. The staff were so friendly and eager to please. And the Breakfast was great. my only complaint is that the Internet was only working on the first night, and then the reception was weak. The rooms were clean and air conditioned, and the shower so powerful it almost bruised me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Thebob00
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days and everything was great, service, food everything

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Very Comfortable, Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mymou
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I picked this hotel as it was part of a vacation package that had the best airfare deal. It was very easy to get to from the airport as it is right on the main tram line from the airport. The street it is on is a large thoroughfare that runs through the busy tourist area of the city, but it wasn't noisy or unsafe for pedestrians. The hotel is located about 10-15 minutes' walk from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and the Spice Bazaar, 5 minutes' walk from the Grand Bazaar, 20-25 minutes' walk from Eminonu, the main ferry port. and minutes from a ton of local eateries and shops. The tram also goes to all these locations if walking is not preferred. The room we stayed in faced a little street and a half-way remodeled building, so there wasn't much of a view, but the comfort of the room more than made up for it. The room itself was fairly large and clean with a queen sized bed and a twin sized bed. We pushed them together for a super king sized bed. The bathroom had a standing shower that had a hand-held shower-head and a ceiling shower head. The water pressure was great and there was plenty of warm and cold water. More importantly, the bathroom was clean and had no strange odors coming through the plumbing. The hotel also offered complimentary breakfast that went until 10am and offered hot dishes like sausage and eggs as well as an assortment of cheeses, cold-cuts, fruits, yogurt, breads, pastries (including little hand-held savory pies), teas, juices, and coffee. The coffee came came from a Nestle machine, but it was strong and tasty with options for espresso, latte, cappuccino, etc. There is also complimentary wireless internet that was very fast. The staff is friendly and helpful about carrying our luggage to the tram stop on our way to the airport. I would return to this hotel the next time I come back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: tobyt13
Reviews.Content: Can't believe it was just a month ago that I spent 5 wonderful days at this hotel. Despite some of the reviews on the Kent Hotel I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean and spacious. The shower was great with plenty of water pressure and hot water. The breakfast buffet had a great assortment to choose from. Had a catered dinner one night in the hotel that left something to be desired but that was the only time other than breakfast I ate in. I was facing the main street and despite traffic which seemed to slow down about 11pm I was able to sleep very peacefully with my window open. The staff was courteous in both the restaurant and at the front desk. Front desk staff was helpful in pointing me in the right direction and was very open to making change (this was not always the case with some of the other hotels I stayed in this trip). Location was great. Walking distance to many of the sights and at those times I felt lazy the tram was just half a block away. The rooms had plenty of outlets to charge any of my electrical appliances and the free wifi in the room meant I could easily use my ipad. If and when I return to Istanbul I would definately consider staying here again

Reviews.Title: “We will recommend Kent Hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: robert_hsj
Reviews.Content: We thought the Kent Hotel couldn't be better. We have found it of chance through the internet. We wanted to stay somewhere reasonable priced, near to attractions, clean, English speaking staff, and also has a reasonable restaurant that we could eat and not try to find a restaurant outside the hotel everynight. All we can say that the rooms were recently refurbished, with great shower heads, clean, tastfully decorated, and very comfortable beds and good size rooms. Breakfast is served with freshly made breads made at the promises (was told by a friendly waiter), with good selection of fresh fruit, cereal and juices, lots to choose from. Dinner is served with a varity to choose from, Turkish food or continental. We thought the food was carefully prepared and served, service was excellent.(We felt that we had our own waiter, serving us), most of all very reasonble priced. Kent Hotel is 5 mins walk from the Grand Bazaar and walking distance to Sultanahmet. What a great location!!! Tram is just in front of the hotel so ne need to get a taxi. The reception staff is very helpful guiding you to how to use the tram. They do speak very good English. Actually you could ask them anything you would like to find about where to go and if they don't know know the answer that soon come back to you with an answer. All in all, I will definately stay there in my next trip and will recommend it to anyone who would like to see this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Nanette1957
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice, large, modern rooms, a pleasant lobby bar with a friendly bartender and is conveniently located near the Grand Bazaar and most of the important sites in the old part of Istanbul. The staff was courteous and helpful. Lots of transportation right at the door to anyplace you need to go in Istanbul. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant commercial hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ross39
Reviews.Content: On arrival around 6 pm I was shown to a west-facing very hot room on the 5th floor with a view of the next-door hotel's roof and air-conditioning - not a bad-looking room but I didn't fancy my chances of a good sleep. I asked the porter who brought my bags and he told me there was no individual control of the air-con, so I decided to try my luck with another room (I am inclined to change my allocated room on group tours, having found that singles often get the short straw !) Was shown an internal room (319) with a plastic -grassed balcony on the central air-shaft, with aircon that I could control. Pleasant design and reasonably spacious, and the bed being around a corner from the door meant it was well insulated from the hallway - I am a very light sleeper. The hand-basin area was quite small, not much room to put out your bits and pieces, which is odd as the shower was quite large. I was promised a better room with a view the following day but as 319 was nice and quiet, no sound of traffic or the mosques at 5.30 am, I stayed put for the second night of our stay. Breakfast was good - I particularly noted excellent bread - with a wide selection. The reception area was hideous, an extraordinary collection of styles, surprising as my room was in pleasant if rather bland international hotel mode. The hotel is in the Aksaray area, known for its cheap rag-trade wholesalers serving the former Soviet Union countries that abut Turkey. Your neighbours are likely to be gigantic and formidable buyers who devour huge platefuls each breakfast rather than other tourists. The hotel is a short distance away from the historic centre, though close to the Grand Bazaar, but is well placed for the tram that takes you to Sultanahmet and across the Golden Horn to Taksim and Beyoglu and is a god-send to tired tourists. If you are staying for several days get an Akbil. I was pleased to find a simple-to-use safe in the room. Only when I was emptying it did I discover that it wasn't screwed to the wall or the shelf ! The staff were dumbfounded when I told them that thought to take it with me !!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnalenaP
Reviews.Content: the hotel staff was always very friendly - especially the barkeeper enjoyed talking and joking with us. our room wasn`t really big, but was always very clean. next to the hotel is a minarett with a good muezzin who is loud and wakes you every morning at 5.30. but it didn`t disturb us too much, actually we always went to sleep again after it and in the end we even liked the sound :-) the hotel is just 10 minutes from the blue mosque and the other sights of the old city (big bazar, hagia sophia etc.) i liked the nice atmosphere, the friendly staff and our room very much and would stay at kent hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “THE KENT HOTEL- best place to stay, very well located, nice staff, good rates and brand new rooms”
Reviews.Author: MLBRASIL
Reviews.Content: On my last trip to Istanbul, I had the pleasure to stay at the Kent Hotel at Beyazit. It was one of the last Hotels I checked at the internet. All of them very expensive for the period I wanted to stay ( from Dec 30th up to Jan 3rd ) and no available accommodation. So ,when I found this Hotel with very good prices , I thought It was going to be one of those terrible experiences... But, what a wonderful surprise!!! I will describe why I really enjoyed staying there. The location is JUST perfect. You have everything you need surrounding the hotel. There is a tram stop ,a bus stop and taxis available just in front of the hotel which can take you from Beyazit to Sultanahmet in 2 minutes or any place you want . The Kent Hotel is surrounded by all kind of shops (shoes, clothes, bags, etc...), also by restaurants, cafes and small markets. There are a lot of salesman along the streets offering all kinds of cheap goods for late presents The Grand Bazar is 200 m from the hotel (opened up to 8 pm) The hotel is 8 min walking from Sultanahmet where the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi are located Free shuttle service from the airport, fits 4 people (as most of hotels) Arrange some transportation for your day of departure at the reception( cost 30 euros) The Hotel Free shuttle service from the airport to the hotel and one of the cheapest charges for the return I found ( 30 euros) The access to the hotel can be by ramp or stairs. The outside look doesnâ€™t show what you have inside. Great reception lounge , toilets, a bar with lcd tv, where you could enjoy a chat or just a drink and a view of the terrace cafe on the second floor where you will enjoy a lovely breakfastâ€¦At reception you can ask about sightseeing, restaurants, trips ,etcâ€¦They are pleased to give you all the info needed. I must highlight at the reception, the very good service , professionalism and attention I have received from Mr.Halit, Mr.Kemal, Ms Sinem and Ismail, the porter I insisted on calling â€œSmileâ€� for his prompt help and for being so lovely to me and my mom. Thanks to all of them and also Ms Betul for my reservation and emails with all the info I requested. The restaurant Nice, the food is tasty, breakfast is very good with hot option, scrambled eggs, sausages, toasts, fruits, yogurt, jams, juices, selection of bread and pastries, lots of tea flavors, chocolate and coffee, etcâ€¦I tried the dinner menu. Nice selection and good portions of food served. Children options. The rooms The rooms are brand new. Comfortable beds, nice in size. The room I stayed in( 217) is good for a couple with a child. What you see is what you get. The room is spacious and good to accommodate two large suitcases. Choose the front ones, they have a balcony facing the street, and although it is a busy one, the rooms are noiseless. Air conditioning and heater control in the room. Nice wardrobe. Room service at reasonable price, small fridge with no expensive amenities. Complimentary slippers. Large doors. Should check if there are rooms for people with disabilities. The Bathroom is not so big, but very neat with a good size shower, hair dryer, new seat, amenities, slippers. Housekeepers are very good but the language barrier is enormous although they are very helpful. I travel a lot and stay in five star hotels always and, even though, the hotel didnâ€™t have the same classification, the service was amazing. Minor Improvements should be done : The lighting as it is a very dark in the rooms. Entertainment: increase choice of international channels My compliments to the Kent Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good but poor staff”
Reviews.Author: lepified
Reviews.Content: Pros: good clean rooms with fridge, blow dryers, desk, and in-room safe. Breakfast buffet was very good with a lot to choose from. Location is good, within walking distance to tourist zone but not within the craziness of the tourist district. Tram is cheap and handy. Buy your tram tickets either at a tobacco kiosk or the machines in front of some of the trams for 175 Turkish Lira for one way. Cons: The staff at the front desk are not the least bit friendly or helpful. They are only helpful if they can make some money off of you - booking dinner, booking a tour, or selling you something like a map. Since the computer (and printer) in the lobby was not working during our entire stay, we were unable to look up the directions to a restaurant where we were to meet friends. So we asked the front desk if they could tell us how to get to the restaurant. The front desk clerk tried to steer us to a different restaurant, where they no doubt made a commission, but we explained we were meeting friends at the other restaurant. The clerk said he was not familiar with our restaurant. I asked him if he could call the restaurant to get directions and he said we could do it ourselves. Of course, we could do it ourselves, however, as the street names are in Turkish and difficult to find, we were hoping he would be better able to direct us since I knew the restaurant was within walking distance. I asked if he cold look it up on the computer and possibly print it for us and charge us for the printing since their computer for guests was not working and he said he was unable to help us and that we should call. It turns out we took an expensive cab (since the cab had to take a roundabout route because of the one-way streets) for all of a 6 block ride we could easily have walked. Also, although there is an airport shuttle that will pick you up at the airport - be sure it is the Ataturk Airport - they will not take you back. They charge 30 euros for the trip back. A taxi is about 60 euros and the tram may take you anywhere from 40 minutes to an hour especially between 4-6 pm. We tried to take the tram but had to let 4 go by as they were too packed to fit another person let alone two people with one piece of luggage. The noise is also a concern. The rooms that face the street are noisy due to the traffic and the rooms that face the sea have a beautiful view but are right next to the minaret speakers which are quite loud as they announce the prayers 5 times a day with the first one at 6:30 am. After one day, however, we were so tired from sightseeing that we simply tune it out. It is a shame the staff is so unfriendly because I would otherwise recommend this hotel. I have worked as a front desk clerk at hotels and I am very aware of what hardships guests have when traveling to a country where they do not know the language and the extra care that is needed. However, the staff at Kent Hotel seem to resent guests and their requests and simply see them as tourists they can trick for extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and cheap hotel, not perfectly located though”
Reviews.Author: frosw
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really great, the room was perfectly decorated and very clean. The breakfast was rich. The staff was kind, except from one man who wasn't any friendly at all. He couldn't find our reservation and his behaviour was like he didn't believe that we had actually booked a room there... The location of the hotel was a bit far from Taksim, which was a problem if we wanted to stay late there for a drink or something... The tram station was in front of the hotel, so that made it a lot easier during the day. I would recomend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: POlivia
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Kent Hotel. Great staff, and clean spacious rooms. The tram is a few steps away, and it gest you everywhere important. Made me feel like home, i would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mcdphd
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Kent. Nice location just a couple of blocks from the Grand Bazaar and light rail right in front. Nice clean rooms, very good food and friendly staff. Very comfortable bed, slept like a baby in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbrowning
Reviews.Content: You can walk to the tram, which will take you everywhere. You can walk to food vendors or restaurants, you can walk to the Grand Bazaar. It is a perfect hotel. I was alone and received room 518. I was apprehensive at first as I walked up a small staircase from the 5th floor, but when I saw my view, I was in Heaven! The room is an add-on, very small, but has a panoramic view of the Bosphorus, Valide Sultan Mosque, and the Sultanahmet. Wonderful. Flat screen tvs in the room, and I loved the large breakfast buffet every day. Staff was really friendly. Pay-per-minute internet in the lounge and a bar. Bed was fine, but we were so exhausted at the end of the day, could have slept on the floor! We had a large group in the cocktail lounge one night and a couple of ladies got pickpocketed by a gypsy teenager. She was caught but squirmed away. Watch your bags, but that is anywhere. Oh, TAKE THE TRAM to the Chemberlitas Baths about two stops down (or you can walk). and enjoy a hamam (Turkish bath!). Also, when you visit Topkapi Palace, pay the extra to see the inside of the Harem - so worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: mark1957s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the sultanahmet area, the tram is steps from the door, the grand bazaar an easy walk. The hotel is clean and rooms are spacious by european standards. Staff was very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: WendyDub
Reviews.Content: Not to be confused with Hotel kent in Istanbul, this one is in the Beyazit area so be sure you stay in this one as the location is perfect.This hotel's location is it's biggest selling point, 5 minute walk to the grand bazaar,10 minute walk to haga sophia and the blue mosque, there is a tram station right in front of the hotel that takes you everywhere around Istanbul and is very cheap.some floors and rooms were recently renovated so as to stay there as the ones that are yet to be renovated are not nice, they checked us in the 1st night in a very small room but we requested they give us a bigger room and they did the next morning which was great, breakfast was quite good

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special to complain”
Reviews.Author: mercan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a walkingdistance from Aksaray station; there was constructionwork going on next to the hotel creating some noise. The room was very clean but needed refurnishing and some paintwork. Breakfast was exellent including local dishes. Staff was very friendly, but didn't speak english very well. The was a fast trams stop (blue line) 100 meters from the hotel, so moving around was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Lousy Food, OK Service”
Reviews.Author: WingCC
Reviews.Content: Part of the Gate 1 Tour stay option. Best Western was only a block away. Very difficult in traffic if you're driving, otherwise, on foot has a lot of convenience. Holiday Inn standard from the US point of view. http://cctravelblog.com/2009/01/15/2008-turkey-istanbul-lodging/

Reviews.Title: “good hotel experience - great location”
Reviews.Author: marlySF
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kent Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning and end of a tour in Nov/Dec, 2008. Hotel was OK overall, although I didn't spend much time there other than sleeping. The two nights at the beginning of the tour were spent in a room with the window opening onto the shaft in the middle of the building. The weather was nasty (very windy/rainy) during that time, so the wind ripped through that shaft and was extremely loud, even though the windows seemed to be new vinyl and double-paned. I couldn't sleep with it whistling loudly. Sounded like a hurricane. The third night (different room) was 10 days later and was in the back of the building. No problem with noise, but the weather was more subdued in December. It was interesting that I couldn't hear the call to prayer the first two nights (yet the wind kept me awake) but the third night, I could hear the call to prayer but no other noise. Depends on where you are in the building, evidently. Being a single traveler on a tour, I had twin beds. Like most twin bed rooms, the beds were narrow and a little stiff but not too uncomfortable. Room had tons of closet space and a nice clean bathroom, with shampoo and a hair dryer, etc. Hotel restaurant was good -- down the elevator, on the mezzanine. We had the buffet in the morning, which had the standard array of breads and fruits and cereals and numerous cheeses/olives. Dinners were not buffets. They were served at the table and the food was quite good, with various mezes (appetizers) and kabobs and many other options. One night the entire Beyazit area lost its power and The Kent had a generator, so we stayed there for dinner rather than wandering down the street to find another restaurant. Ten of us had a price fixed menu that night with 4 or 5 courses which was only $17 - 20 USD each and had so much good healthy food, I couldn't finish. Location is ideal The Kent is one block away from the entrance to the Grand Bazaar (to the right as you exit the hotel) and nearby gobs of shops with everything one could possibly be tempted by --- and with the tram (University stop) right across the street. From the tram, it's easy to get to the Sultanahmet district to all the tourist attractions. There is some major construction going on next door, lately -- so, if on that side of the building, it could either be noisy or have a view of the deep pit depending on the day or time of day. Looks like they are either building another hotel or a commercial building. My tour company paid the bill for my stay at this hotel, but I'd stay there again, even on my own. The staff at the desk was a bit abupt and surly but the wait staff in the restaurant was very gracious and friendly. Most spoke English quite well.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel i enjoyed very much”
Reviews.Author: tzfoni
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed the hotel very much just came from my vacation and the hotel was one of the reasons it was a good one. rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. the cooling in the air condition was not working but i understand this is the standard in turkey... the breakfast was obove expectation,3 kinds of cereal,good cofee, at least 5 kinds of petiseries,not at all a basic continental breakfast. important because i came with kids. the view from the room was to beyazid mosque and marmara sea . therestaurant is above the street with interesting view. the staff was polite and helpful. there is a problem with the shower heads that are old and the water goes mostly to the sides- but this is a small prob. to make the story short - very recommended especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Euro_Al
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kent in 1999 and was so impressed with the hotel and the value I received for my money that I decided to stay there again. The hotel is well located (especially convenient to the Grand Bazaar) the public areas are nice and the rooms are clean and the staff is courteous. My experience this time around was also good, but not quite as good as 9 years ago. The staff are still very professional and courteous, however if you ask about any low cost tour options, you will be given all the standard high cost tour recommendations. We wanted an inexpensive boat tour and found a lovely one ourselves that the front desk seemed not to know about. The rooms are standard but could definately use a freshening up, so if you are put off by the odd scratch or stain or tear, then this is not the place for you. The breakfast buffet is reasonable however there is a surcharge for omlettes so if that puts you off, at least you have been warned. All in all I think that for the money, this is an excellent and reliable hotel and I would stay here again if I was in need of mid-range accomodation. I have stayed at more expensive and upmarket hotels in Istanbul such as the Marmara in Taksim, which I would recommend for more fussy travelers who are willing to pay more, however if you don't need fancy soaps, fluffy towels, an incredible breakfast buffet and a flawless room, the Kent is more than reliable as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tibbrit2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice at the beginning and end of our Turkey trip. Nice hotel opposite University and three stops on the tram to the Blue Mosque and Aghia Sofia. Very convenient for most tourist attractions. Rooms are small but clean, breakfast more than adequate and the service friendly (except for one of the front desk staff who is a bit grumpy). I note that some of the reviews say this is not a four-star hotel and perhaps this is true in US/European terms but it is perfectly adequate and we would stay here again One issue - there is a construction site next to the Hotel which did not appear to be active when we were there but at some point this may become a problem - worth checking on this before you make a reservation.

HotelInfo.Name: Kent Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Ordu Cad. No:2/4 Beyazit, Istanbul 34490, Turkey
